title: Remembering Icons: A Look at Notable Figures Lost in 2025
summary: The article commemorates several prominent individuals who died in 2025, highlighting their significant contributions across entertainment, religion, and culture. It features Hollywood legends such as Diane Keaton, who earned an Oscar for Annie Hall and had a notable partnership with Woody Allen, and Robert Redford, renowned for his acting in films like Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid and for founding the Sundance Film Festival to support independent cinema. Other figures include Pope Francis, the first non-European Pope in over a millennium, and Ozzy Osbourne, a famous rock musician. The piece also covers actors like Gene Hackman, known for his tough-guy roles in The French Connection, and Prunella Scales, celebrated for her role in Fawlty Towers. By detailing their careers and personal stories, the article aims to preserve their legacies and illustrate their impact on global audiences, serving as a tribute to their lives and work.
